channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On a 3D Stokes eigenvalue problem under Navier slip-with-friction boundary conditions and applications to Navier-Stokes equations
item.description: arXiv:2407.07496v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we consider, by means of a precise spectral analysis, the 3D Navier-Stokes equations endowed with Navier slip-with-friction boundary conditions. We study the problem in a very simple geometric situation as the region between two parallel planes, with periodicity along the two planes. This setting, which is often used in the theory of boundary layers, requires some special treatment for what concerns the functional setting and allows us to characterize in a rather explicit manner eigenvalues and eigenfunctions of the associated Stokes problem. These, will be then used in order to identify infinite dimensional classes of data leading to global strong solutions for the corresponding evolution Navier-Stokes equations.
item.dc:creator: Luigi C. Berselli, Alessio Falocchi, Rossano Sannipoli

item.title: On boundary conditions for linearised Einstein's equations
item.description: arXiv:2407.07576v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We investigate the properties of a fairly large class of boundary conditions for the linearised Einstein equations in the Riemannian setting, ones which generalise the linearised counterpart of boundary conditions proposed by Anderson. Through the prism of the quest to quantise gravitational waves in curved spacetimes, we study their properties from the point of view of ellipticity, gauge invariance, and the existence of a spectral gap.
item.dc:creator: Matteo Capoferri, Simone Murro, Gabriel Schmid

item.title: On gaps in the spectra of quasiperiodic Schr\"odinger operators with discontinuous monotone potentials
item.description: arXiv:2407.00705v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that, for one-dimensional discrete Schr\"odinger operators, stability of Anderson localization under a class of rank one perturbations implies absence of intervals in spectra. The argument is based on well-known result of Gordon and del Rio--Makarov--Simon, combined with a way to consider perturbations whose ranges are not necessarily cyclic. The main application of the results is showing that a class of quasiperiodic operators with sawtooth-like potentials, for which such a version of stable localization is known, has Cantor spectra. We also obtain several results on gap filling under rank one perturbations for some general (not necessarily monotone) classes of quasiperiodic operators with discontinuous potentials.
item.dc:creator: Ilya Kachkovskiy, Leonid Parnovski, Roman Shterenberg

item.title: FBI Transform in Gevrey Classes and Anosov Flows
item.description: arXiv:2001.03610v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: An analytic FBI transform is built on compact manifolds without boundary, that satisfies all the expected properties. It enables the study of microlocal analytic and Gevrey regularity on such manifolds. This tool is then used to study the Ruelle spectrum of Anosov flows with Gevrey coefficients. In particular, finite order for the associated dynamical determinant is proved.
item.dc:creator: Yannick Guedes Bonthonneau, Malo J\'ez\'equel

item.title: Upper bound on the number of resonances for even asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds with real-analytic ends
item.description: arXiv:2209.06064v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove a polynomial upper bound on the number of resonances in a disc whose radius tends to infinity for even asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds with real-analytic ends. Our analysis also gives a similar upper bound on the number of quasinormal frequencies for Schwarzschild-de Sitter spacetimes.
item.dc:creator: Malo J\'ez\'equel

item.title: Asymptotics for the spectral function on Zoll manifolds
item.description:
arXiv:2211.09644v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $(M,g)$ be a Zoll manifold, i.e., a smooth, compact, Riemannian manifold without boundary all of whose geodesics are closed with a minimal common period $T$. The positive definite Laplace-Beltrami operator has eigenvalues $\{\lambda_j^2\}_j$ which cluster around $
u^2_\ell$ for some sequence $
u_\ell	o \infty$. This article is concerned with the number of $\lambda_j$ in a window of fixed size $\mathrm{w}$ around $
u_\ell$, denoted by $\mathbf{N}(
u_\ell,\mathrm{w}):=\#\{j\,:\, \lambda_j\in[
u_\ell-\mathrm{w},
u_\ell+\mathrm{w}]\}.$ When the set of trajectories with period smaller than $T$ has zero measure, there is $c_{n}>0$, depending only on $n=\operatorname{dim} M$, such that $$ \mathbf{N}(
u_\ell,\mathrm{w}) =c_n\operatorname{vol}_g(M)
u_{\ell}^{n-1}+o(
u_{\ell}^{n-1}), $$ as $\ell 	o \infty$. However, for a general Zoll manifold this may not be the case. We show that, nevertheless, there is $N>0$, independent of $\ell$, such that $$ \sum_{j=0}^{N-1}\mathbf{N}(
u_{\ell+j},\mathrm{w})= c_nN\operatorname{vol}_g(M)
u_{\ell}^{n-1}+o(
u_{\ell}^{n-1}), $$ as $\ell 	o \infty$. In addition to asymptotics for the counting function, we study the kernel of the spectral projector for the Laplacian, $\Pi_{\ell,\mathrm{w}}(x,y)$ onto the spectrum in ${ igcup_{j=0}^{N-1}[
u_{\ell+j}-\mathrm{w},
u_{\ell+j}+\mathrm{w}]}$. We show that for $x$ and $y$ in a shrinking neighborhood of a point with few loops of length smaller than $T$, $\Pi_{\ell,\mathrm{w}}(x,y)$ and its derivatives have the same asymptotics as those on the round sphere and flat torus.
item.dc:creator: Yaiza Canzani, Jeffrey Galkowski, Blake Keeler
